p: This large glycoprotein (approx. 180Â kDa) is present on the viral surface as a prominent trimer, each monomer ectodomain being composed of S1 and S2 domains ( Fig. 3B). Although the sequence comparison of the S protein between SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 indicates only 76% identity (large variations exist at the N-terminus), it has been assumed that their folding is similar [25].
